en.title: FusionExcel Donates VND 50 Million (RM 10,000) to Vietnam Special Needs Children.
en.content:
REPORT BY VIETNAM COUNTRY LICENSEE DOAN NGUYEN.

Football Tournament for Disadvantaged Children 2009.

FE is proud to donate VND 50 Million (RM 10,000) to the Vietnam Special Needs Children for their annual Football Tournament. This annual Football Tournament for underprivileged children was officially opened on 27th May 2009 in Ho Chi Minh City with the participation of eight local and international teams. Former Vietnam Vice-President Mrs Truong My Hoa and representatives from many organizations including Vietnam Football Federation, HCM City Football Federation and more than 1000 children were present at the opening ceremony. The organization board was also very honoured to receive a bouquet from the President of Vietnam, Mr Nguyen Minh Triet. Started in 1999, this annual Football Tournament is a meaningful sports activity for children from SOS villages and shelter houses from all over Vietnam. The children come to compete, play and make friends throughout the event. 

This year, the teams are from Hanoi and the provinces of Gia Lai, Dong Nai, Dong Thap, and Ca Mau in Vietnam, as well as Cambodia and Thailand. These eight teams played daily at the Military Zone 7 Indoor Stadium in Tan Binh District from 27th - 31st May, 2009.

The winner of this year's tournament will receive VND20 million (US$1,100) while the next three runners-up will be awarded VND15 million, VND10 million and VND5 million respectively. 

Following the tournament, a Vietnamese team will be selected to participate in a friendly tour to Thailand in September. The team will be chosen by the event’s organizers, the Cong An TPHCM (HCMC Police) and the Thao Viet Nam (Vietnam Sports) newspapers, and the Vietnam Data Communication Company (VDC) - Southern Region.
